Allow floating point values for LAME VBR quality

ToDo ---------
When encoding is aborted because of restricted access and the output dir changed before restart, BonkEnc tries to write the aborted track to the old dir.

TASK.TITLE: Use the Bonk library for all Bonk plugins
Test and make it work again on all versions of Windows
Support .oga extension for Ogg Vorbis files
Allow multiple configurations saved under different names
Add an option to skip all existing files
Implement BonkEnc Component Architecture
TASK.COMMENTS:
BoCA ---------
BonkEnc:
- ComponentRegistry importiert C-API und erzeugt Objekte - BonkEnc will parse all files that match the pattern boca_*.dll and boca_*.xml
Plug-In:
- Plugins supply XML configuration data specifying their attributes - Plain XML files can configure e.g. command line encoders/decoders - Wrapper (als Header eingebunden) exportiert Funktionen als C-API
Input filter:
- Make sure a format definition is provided to the filter prior to activation

TASK.TITLE: Support encoding with multiple rippers at once
TASK.COMMENTS:
Encoder Threads
- Task-Pool wird erzeugt - Definiert wie einzelne Tasks voneinander abhängen
- Beispiel:
Task 1 - Rip track 1 - Predecessors: none Task 2 - Rip track 2 - Predecessors: (1, finished) Task 3 - Decode file 1 - Predecessors: none Task 4 - Encode track 1 - Predecessors: (1, started) Task 5 - Encode track 2 - Predecessors: (2, started) Task 6 - Encode file 1 - Predecessors: (3, started)
Ablauf (4 CPUs): 1: Task 1….Task 2…. 2: Task 4…... 3: Task 3…. Task5…... 4: Task 6…...
Ablauf (2 CPUs): 1: Task 1….Task 2....Task 5…... 2: Task 3….Task 4……Task 6…...
- Einzelne Tasks werden gestartet wenn alle Vorgänger bereit sind - Benötigt Input-/Output-Buffer für gemeinsamen Zugriff auf Audiodaten

TASK.TITLE: Add helper wizards
TASK.COMMENTS:
ToDo ----------
- Implement a wizard framework "Oz". - Based on XML it will generate any wizard. - "Steps" are defined and put together to form "Tasks". - Each wizard performs one task. - Images read from PCI/PNG/JPEG through ImageReaders. - Functions will be defined by the application (similarly as in ECM). - Optional: Scripting with JavaScript, DLLs to provide ready-made dialogs.
- "Steps" could be things like "Select format", "Select output directory", "Change track order". - "Tasks" coulb be things like "Split CUE sheet to individual tracks", "Rip CD to audio book", "Convert music library for mobile device".
- Organized similarly to BoCA:
- Directory: freac/oz
oz.1.0.dll oz_step_select_format.1.0.dll oz_step_select_directory.1.0.xml oz_task_split_cuesheet.1.0.dll oz_task_rip_to_audiobook.1.0.xml

TASK.TITLE: Add support for rebuilding the input path in the output directory
TASK.COMMENTS:
ToDo ---------
Add a filename pattern placeholder <directory> similar to the existing <filename> placeholder.
Then allow placeholders like <directory-1> to be used to strip the first element from the directory structure.
E.g. if the original file is in "C:\Music\Rock\Metallica - The Unforgiven", <directory> will map to "Music\Rock\Metallica - The Unforgiven" while <directory-1> will map to "Rock\Metallica - The Unforgiven".

TASK.TITLE: Fix Winamp input length reporting
TASK.COMMENTS:
ToDo ---------
We can use format.approxLength with Winamp plug-ins. However, the progress bar will immediately jump to 100% then when encoding starts.
To fix that, we could make the progress bar react on the actual number of samples processed rather than the number of bytes. We could use a heuristic to determine which method is better for a given conversion (i.e. use the new method when the component reports usage of a lot of bytes very quickly although we didn't process lots of samples yet).
